Description: THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE TRUST FOR PUBLIC LANDS IN LOS ANGELES, CA TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE L.A. RIVER VERDUGO WASH AREA. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THREE CATALYST SITES AND ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY OF REDEVELOPMENT ALONG THE L.A. RIVER PROVIDING OPEN AND RECREATION SPACES.  THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,000. PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 4/1/2017.
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF FRESNO, CA TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE ELM STREET CORRIDOR IN SOUTHWEST FR
THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR CITY OF BURLINGTON TO CONDUCT AREA WIDE PLANNING AND AN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY IN DOWNTOWN BURLINGTON, IOWA.
THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND DEVELOPMENT TO CONDUCT BROWNFIELDS AREA WIDE PLANNING IN POSTVILLE, IOWA.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF OREM TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE GENEVA ROAD AREA. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES WITH A FOCUS AROUND ITS CATALYST SITE. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN ACT FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY RESEARCH CORPORATION TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES ON BROWNFIELD ISSUES TO RESIDENTS OF PENNSYLVANIA, WEST VIRGINIA, DELAWARE, DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, MARYLAND, AND VIRGINIA IN HELPING COMMUNITIES TACKLE THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP, AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. THE WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY RESEARCH CORPORATION, BROWNFIELDS ASSISTANCE CENTER (BAC) AT WEST VIRGINIA UNIVERSITY WILL ADDRESS THE BROWNFIELD CHALLENGES OF LOCAL CAPACITY AND PROJECT UNCERTAINTY FACED IN THE MID-ATLANTIC AREA THROUGH THE 'REGION 3 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BROWNFIELDS COMMUNITIES' PROGRAM BY EDUCATING STAKEHOLDERS ON THE BROWNFIELD REDEVELOPMENT PROCESS INCLUDING HOW TO IDENTIFY A BROWNFIELD, SITE REUSE PLANNING OPTIONS, WAYS TO ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY IN THE PROJECT, THE IMPACTS THE SITES HAVE ON PUBLIC HEALTH, THE TYPES AND REASONS FOR THE DIFF

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ROWAN UNIVERSITY TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE PHILADELPHIA'S LOWER NORTH DELAWARE INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF NORFOLK TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE NORFOLK BROWNFIELDS THRIVE AREA. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES. THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED AREA-WIDE PLAN AND  IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY. REUSE WILL INCORPORATE FLOOD-PROOFING TECHNOLOGIES AND STRATEGIES, CREATE NATURAL BUFFERS AND STORMWATER GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE, AND DEVELOP PUBLIC ACCESS TO OPEN SPACE.
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE SOUTH BRONX OVERALL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR BROWNFIELDS IN THE BRONX

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ISLES, INC. TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR BROWNFIELDS IN TRENTON, NEW JERSEY.  THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY.  ISLES, INC. WILL CREATE AN AREA-WIDE REUSE PLAN THAT INCORPORATES COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND THAT CONNECTS TO OTHER TRENTON, NEW JERSEY, AND NATIONAL COMMUNITY RENEWAL INITIATIVES.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AMERICAN RESCUE PLAN AND CERCLA 104 (K)(7) FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY (NJIT) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES TO COMMUNITIES IN NEW JERSEY, NEW YORK, PUERTO RICO, AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS. NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY WILL ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY WILL HELP STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND COMPLEX BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES BY PROVIDING SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDING COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REVITALIZATION PROCESS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SIX SUBJECT AREAS: (1) COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, (2) HEALTH IMPACTS OF BROWNFIELD SITES, (3) SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION, (4) INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT, (5) BROWNFIELDS FINANCE, (6) STATE, TERRITORIAL TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS.
THE NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BROWNFIELDS PROGRAM SERVES AS AN INDEPENDENT RESOURCE ASSISTING STATE, REGIONAL, COUNTY, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND NONPROFITS. NEW JERSEY INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGYS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INCLUDES: EXPLAINING THE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELD SITE ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION ACTIVITIESAND DEVELOPING GRANT MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUESAND PRIORITIZING SITESAND DEVELOPING STRATEGIES TO INTEGRATE APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELD CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENTAND FACILITATING STAKEHOLDER INVOLVEMENTAND IDENTIFYING SOURCES OF BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT AND CLEANUP FUNDINGAND EXPLAINING STATE BROWNFIELDS AND VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM REQUIREMENTSAND AND DEVELOPING STRATEGIES FOR SITE REDEVELOPMENT AND FACILITATING REDEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP AND CERCLA 104 (K)(7) STAG FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO CENTER FOR CREATIVE LAND RECYCLING (CCLR) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES TO COMMUNITIES IN EPA REGION 9 AND 10. CCLR WILL ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: CCLR WILL HELP STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND COMPLEX BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES BY PROVIDING SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDING COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REVITALIZATION PROCESS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SIX SUBJECT AREAS: (1) COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, (2) HEALTH IMPACTS OF BROWNFIELD SITES, (3) SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION, (4) INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT, (5) BROWNFIELDS FINANCE, (6) STATE, TERRITORIAL TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVE

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THIS ARP AND CERCLA 104 (K)(7) STAG FUNDED COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY (KSU) TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES TO COMMUNITIES IN EPA REGIONS 5-8 AND NATIONALLY. KSU WILL ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: KSU WILL HELP STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND COMPLEX BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES BY PROVIDING SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDING COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REVITALIZATION PROCESS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SIX SUBJECT AREAS: (1) COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, (2) HEALTH IMPACTS OF BROWNFIELD SITES, (3) SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION, (4) INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT, (5) BROWNFIELDS FINANCE, (6) STATE, TERRITORIAL TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS.
EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COMMUNITIES, ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL, TRIBAL, AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, TO INCREASE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF BROWNFIELD-RELATED ISSUES AND CAPACITY TO ADVANCE BROWNFIELD SITES TOWARD CLEANUP AND REUSE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE A BROAD RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS (E.G., TRIBAL, STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER NON-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES), ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CHALLENGES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO ISSUE SUBAWARD AGREEMENTS TO ITS PARTNERS IN COMPLIANCE WITH APPENDIX A OF EPA&RSQUOANDS SUBAWARD POLICY.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE NATIONWIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RESOURCES TO COACH AND TRAIN BROWNFIELDS COMMUNITIES ON A VARIETY OF INNOVATIVE AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT APPROACHES TO PROVIDE LOW-INCOME AND MINORITY RESIDENTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN AND DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM BROWNFIELDS REVITALIZATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RESOURCES RESULTING FROM THIS PROJECT WILL ENCOURAGE LONG-TERM COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION AND BUILD LOCAL CAPACITY AMONG RESIDENTS, ORGANIZATIONS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND INSTITUTIONS.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR EASTERN IOWA COMMUNITY COLLEGE DISTRICT-HAZARDOUS MATERIAL TRAINING AND RESOURCE INSTITUTE (EICCD-HMTRI) TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES FACING CHALLENGES WITH ESTABLISHING OR CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND JOB TRAINING  (EWDJT) PROGRAMS IN ORDER TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PLACE LOCAL, UNEMPLOYED AND UNDER-EMPLOYED RESIDENTS WITH THE SKILLS NEEDED TO SECURE FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT IN THE ENVIRONMENTAL FIELD.

ICMA WILL COOPERATE WITH EPA, AS THE NON-FEDERAL CO-SPONSOR FOR THE NATIONAL BROWNFIELDS TRAINING CONFERENCE, IN THE DEVELOPMENT, PLANNING, AND DELIVERY OF THREE NATIONAL CONFERENCES TO BE HELD BETWEEN 2019 AND 2024.

THIS TRIBAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BROWNFIELDS PROJECT WILL SERVE TRIBAL COMMUNITIES NATIONWIDE TO DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE TRIBAL RESPONSE PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN ON-LINE TRIBAL BROWNFIELDS FORUM, NATIONAL TAB WEB RESOURCES, ROUNDTABLES, WORKSHOPS AND WEBINARS, CAPACITY-BUILDING AND EVALUATION TOOLS AND SITE-SPECIFIC TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ADDRESS CHALLENGES FACED BY TRIBAL BROWNFIELDS COMMUNITIES.

THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS THE WORK OF THE STATE RESPONSE AND BROWNFIELDS TASK FORCE, PROVIDING STATE PROGRAMS WITH TIMELY INFORMATION AND TRAINING REGARDING NEW DEVELOPMENTS IN THE FIELD OF WASTE SITE CLEANUP, INCLUDING THE IMPLICATIONS OF RECENTLY RELEASED FEDERAL GUIDANCE AND POLICIES, SO THAT STATES CAN CONTINUE TO DEVELOP AND ENHANCE THEIR RESPONSE PROGRAMS IN ORDER TO ASSESS, CLEANUP, AND PROMOTE THE SUSTAINABLE REUSE OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES.  THE STATE RESPONSE AND BROWNFIELDS TASK FORCE MAKEUP AND OUTREACH EFFORTS WILL ENSURE THAT ALL KEY ASPECTS OF STATE RESPONSE PROGRAMS ARE REPRESENTED, INCLUDING CONSIDERATION OF OTHER COMPONENTS OF STATE RESPONSE PROGRAMS, SUCH AS RCRA AND UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS, IN ADDITION TO VOLUNTARY CLEANUP.
THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES IN REGIONS 5, 6, 7, 8, AND THE NATION ON BROWNFIELD ISSUES WITH THE GOAL
THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE RECIPIENT TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES IN REGIONS 1, 3 AND 4 ON BROWNFIELD ISSUES WITH THE GOA
THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS THE CENTER FOR CREATIVE LAND RECYCLING TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES IN REGIONS 2, 9 AND 10 ON BROW
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR UNIVERSITY OF LOUISVILLE TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CLE
THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO CONDUCT RESEARCH AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REUSE CHALLENGES
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR GROUNDWORK USA TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REUSE CHALLENGES. SPEC
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR EASTERN IOWA COMMUNITY COLLEGE TO DELIVER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO NEW, EXISTING, AND PROSPECTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL WORK

THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $700,000 TO THE INTERNATIONAL CITY/COUNTY MANAGEMENT ASSOCIATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR THE RECIPIENT TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES TO COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY REGION 4 SERVICE AREA, INCLUDING ALABAMA, GEORGIA, FLORIDA, KENTUCKY, MISSISSIPPI, NORTH CAROLINA, SOUTH CAROLINA, TENNESSEE, AND THE SIX FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES CONTAINED THEREIN. THE RECIPIENT WILL ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE HELPING STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND COMPLEX BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES BY PROVIDING SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDING COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP, AND REVITALIZATION PROCESS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SIX SUBJECT AREAS: (1) COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, (2) HEALTH IMPACTS OF BROWNFIELD SITES, (3) SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION, (4) INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELDS CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT, (5) BROWNFIELDS FINANCE, (6) STATE, TERRITORIAL TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMS. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TRAINING, WORKSHOPS, SPECIFIC ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES, SUCH AS REVIEW OF DRAFT PROPOSALS, AND POSSIBLE ANALYSIS OF ECONOMIC BENEFITS FOR A COMMUNITY OR REUSE PLANNING. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COMMUNITIES, ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL, TRIBAL, AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, TO INCREASE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF BROWNFIELD-RELATED ISSUES AND CAPACITY TO ADVANCE BROWNFIELD SITES TOWARD CLEANUP AND REUSE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE A BROAD RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS (E.G., TRIBAL, STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER NON-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES), ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL, AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CHALLENGES. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE LOCAL, PEER-TO-PEER ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING.

FUNDING  IS PROVIDED FOR THE CITY OF GRANTS PASS, OREGON TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR BROWNFIELDS. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY PRIORITIES, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS PLAN AND DESIGN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY. PLANNING ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS AROUND THE SPALDING MILL AREA IN THE EASTERN PART OF GRANTS PASS. THE 61-ACRE AREA WAS SELECTED DUE TO ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS, PROXIMITY TO TRANSPORTATION CORRIDORS AND SENSITIVE POPULATIONS, HISTORY OF DISINVESTMENT, REUSE POTENTIAL, AND COMMUNITY NEED FOR ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE PORT OF NEW ORLEANS TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE PORT'S INDUSTRIAL CANAL CORRIDOR. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY.THE  BF AWP PROCESS WILL HELP THE PORT AND CITY MAKE MEANINGFUL AND THOUGHTFUL DECISIONS ABOUT FUTURE DEVELOPMENTS TO ESCALATE ECONOMIC VIABILITY AND ENHANCE ENVIRONMENTAL AND SOCIAL SUSTAINABILITY OF THE AREA. THE PORT WILL LEAD THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE BF AWP IN CLOSE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CITY, THROUGH A TRANSPARENT AND INCLUSIVE PLANNING PROCESS, SUBSTANTIALLY BOLSTERED BY THE CREDIBILITY OF EPA GRANT FUNDING, GUIDANCE AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR ACTIVITIES IN SUPPORT OF BROW
THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CITY OF WHITEWRIGHT, TEXAS TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE DOWNTOWN CORRIDOR. THE AREA

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR LORAIN COUNTY TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE BROADWAY & 28TH STREET CORRIDOR. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES. THE GRANTEE WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY. AREA BY THE WATERFRONT HOPES TO BE REDEVELOPED FOR ECONOMIC AND GREEN-SPACE OPPORTUNITIES.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR WAYNE COUNTY BROWNFIELD REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY TO CONDUCT AREA-WIDE PLANNING FOR THE BROWNFIELDS IN THE CITY OF RIVER ROUGE'S DOWNTOWN AREA, THE AREA OF THE DTE ENERGY ROUGE RIVER POWER PLANT, AND THE NEIGHBORHOOD IN BETWEEN THESE TWO SITES. THE AREA-WIDE PLAN WILL INFORM SUBSEQUENT BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REUSE ACTIVITIES.  WAYNE COUNTY BROWNFIELD REDEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY WILL CONDUCT COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ACTIVITIES TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, RESEARCH THE EXISTING CONDITIONS OF THE BROWNFIELDS AREA, DETERMINE REUSES FOR BROWNFIELD SITES, AND DEVELOP A DETAILED BROWNFIELDS AREA-WIDE PLAN AND PLAN IMPLEMENTATION STRATEGY.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,000 TO THE BERKELEY-CHARLESTON-DORCHESTER COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS TO BE UTILIZED BY THE COUNCIL TO ADVANCE CRITICAL PLANNING AND STRATEGIC ACTIONS NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THE REMEDIATION AND REVITALIZATION NEEDS OF BROWNFIELD SITES IN THE PROJECT AREA, AS WELL AS SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE NEW AND EXISTING BUSINESSES IN DEVELOPING AND PROMOTING REVITALIZATION OF THE PROJECT AREA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT TO CONDUCT ELIGIBLE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS AUTHORIZED BY CERCLA 104(K)(7). THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES TO COMMUNITIES IN EPA REGION 1. 
ACTIVITIES:THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT WILL ASSIST THESE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT WILL HELP STAKEHOLDERS UNDERSTAND COMPLEX BROWNFIELDS-RELATED ISSUES BY PROVIDING SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE AND GUIDING COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE ASSESSMENT, CLEANUP AND REVITALIZATION PROCESS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN THE SIX SUBJECT AREAS: (1) COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, (2) HEALTH IMPACTS OF BROWNFIELD SITES, (3) SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY RELATING TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND SITE PREPARATION, (4) INTEGRATED APPROACHES TO BROWNFIELDS ASSESSMENT CLEANUP AND REDEVELOPMENT, (5) BROWNFIELDS FINANCE, (6) STATE, TERRITORIAL TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT BROWNFIELDS PROGRAMSSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE COMMUNITIES, ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL, TRIBAL, AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, TO INCREASE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF BROWNFIELD-RELATED ISSUES AND CAPACITY TO ADVANCE BROWNFIELD SITES TOWARD CLEANUP AND REUSE. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE A BROAD RANGE OF STAKEHOLDERS (E.G., TRIBAL, STATE, LOCAL AND OTHER NON-GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES), ESPECIALLY SMALL, RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES FACING BROWNFIELDS CHALLENGES.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT (UCONN)  TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO COMMUNITIES ON BROWNFIELD ISSUES TO RESIDENTS OF SIX NEW ENGLAND STATES INCLUDING CONNECTICUT, MAINE, MASSACHUSETTS, NEW HAMPSHIRE, RHODE ISLAND, AND VERMONT AND THE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES IN HELPING COMMUNITIES TACKLE THE CHALLENGE OF ASSESSING, CLEANING UP AND PREPARING BROWNFIELD SITES FOR REDEVELOPMENT.  THEY WILL PROVIDE TRAININGS, WEBINARS AND WORKSHOP BOTH IN PERSON AND VIRTUALLY.  THEY WILL CONDUCT ONLINE SHORT COURSES THAT ARE RELATED TO BROWNFIELDS TOPICS IN NEW NEW ENGLAND. AS WELL AS COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT WITH MUNICIPALITIES AND RESIDENTS.  SPECIFIC TRAINING WILL INCLUDE THE MUNICIPAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM WHICH INCLUDES SERVICE-LEARNING COURSES HELPING COMMUNITIES WITH CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND STORMWATER MANAGEMENT PROJECTS. CONTINUING EDUCATION INCLUDES WEBINARS, WORKSHOPS AND BOOTCAMPS RELATED TO BROWNFIELD TOPICS.
